items.headline: NBA All-Star Game Introduces New Format
items.summary: The NBA is experimenting with its fourth All-Star Game format in as many years, featuring a round-robin tournament between a veteran American All-Star team, a younger US team ('Stars'), and a World team, culminating in a championship game.

items.headline: Commissioner Adam Silver Addresses Escalating 'Tanking' Concerns
items.summary: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver voiced significant concerns over an increase in 'tanking' by teams this season, where franchises intentionally lose to improve draft odds. The league is actively exploring remedies beyond fines, including potentially revoking draft picks, after the Jazz and Pacers were recently fined for roster management.

items.headline: Luka Doncic Cleared to Play in All-Star Game with Restrictions
items.summary: Despite a left hamstring strain that sidelined him for the Lakers' final four games before the break, superstar Luka Doncic is set to start for Team World in today's All-Star Game, albeit on a strict minutes restriction.

items.headline: Damian Lillard Makes History with Third 3-Point Contest Title
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers guard Damian Lillard, who has missed the entire season recovering from a torn left Achilles, made a triumphant return to win his record-tying third career NBA Three-Point Contest on Saturday, equaling marks set by Larry Bird and Craig Hodges.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Day-to-Day with Back Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija (ISR) did not play in Thursday's game against the Jazz due to a back injury and is currently listed as day-to-day. His next scheduled game is February 21st.

items.headline: No Regular Season Games on February 14th
items.summary: The NBA schedule for Friday, February 14, 2026, featured no regular season games due to the ongoing All-Star Weekend festivities in Los Angeles.

items.headline: Today: The 75th NBA All-Star Game (New Format)
items.summary: The highly anticipated 75th NBA All-Star Game will take place today, Sunday, February 15, 2026, at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood, CA. The new format features a round-robin tournament among Team World, USA Stars, and USA Stripes. Tip-off is scheduled for 2:00 PM PT (5:00 PM ET).

items.headline: Lillard Ties Record with Third 3-Point Title
items.statContext: Damian Lillard matched Larry Bird and Craig Hodges with his third career NBA Three-Point Contest victory on Saturday.

items.headline: Keshad Johnson Soars to Slam Dunk Title
items.statContext: Miami Heat's Keshad Johnson secured the Slam Dunk Contest title, showcasing an impressive array of aerial maneuvers.

items.headline: LeBron James Extends All-Star Appearance Record
items.statContext: LeBron James is set to make his record 21st All-Star Game appearance, having been selected an unprecedented 22 times in his 23-year career.

items.headline: Post-Trade Deadline: Reflecting on Major Moves
items.summary: With the NBA trade deadline having passed on February 6th, the league is still buzzing from significant roster changes. Key deals included Anthony Davis moving to the Washington Wizards, James Harden joining the Cleveland Cavaliers, Jaren Jackson Jr. heading to the Utah Jazz, and Kristaps Porzingis landing with the Golden State Warriors.

items.headline: Key Star Player Injury Updates Ahead of All-Star Break
items.summary: Beyond Luka Doncic's All-Star appearance, Kyrie Irving (DAL) is recovering from an ACL injury and plans to address his return timeline post-All-Star break. Damian Lillard (POR) remains out for the season with an Achilles tear, though he surprised many with his 3-point contest win. Stephen Curry, Giannis Antetokounmpo, and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander are also sidelined for the All-Star Game. Rookie Cooper Flagg (DAL) missed the Rising Stars game with a midfoot sprain.

items.headline: Conference Leaders and Playoff Picture Shaping Up
items.summary: As of February 14, 2026, the Oklahoma City Thunder lead the Western Conference with a 42-14 record, followed by the San Antonio Spurs (37-16) and Houston Rockets (33-20). In the Eastern Conference, the Detroit Pistons sit atop the standings at 39-13, with the Boston Celtics (34-19) and New York Knicks (34-20) close behind.
